Content.Name: 2013 Faculty Conference & Schedule
Content.Title: 2013 Faculty Conference and Schedule
Content.BodyCopy:
Dear Faculty Member:

The BYU-Idaho's Faculty Conference is a forum for academic dialogue where faculty members from different disciplines exchange developed ideas and ruminate together at this unique university.

On September 11, 2013, the conference will begin in the Hinckley Chapel at 9:30 am. This year's keynote address, titled "Let Us Go On Unto Perfection," will be given by David Magleby from the Teacher Education Department. From 10:00 am to 1:00 pm, faculty presenters from across campus will share their distinctive insights into our profession (see presentation schedule below or presentation abstracts here). We invite you to participate in the discussions, as your questions this year will be the foundation of the next year's dialogue.

Faculty excursions return this year. Starting at 1:30 pm, you will have the opportunity to participate in activities that include a tour of the Special Collections & Iron Acorn Press, a tour of BYU-Idaho Art, a Rafting Trip, a Teton Dam Flood Excursion, or a Mesa Falls Excursion. Visit the Faculty Conference Excursions page for more information on these events.

Registration for the 2013 BYU-Idaho Faculty Conference is now closed. If you have any questions or concerns, contact Maria Nate at NateM@byui.edu.

Sincerely,

Dialogue Committee
The Learning & Teaching Council

9:30-10:00
